author: Special Correspondent
text:
Staff nurses explaining the importance of health at an exhibition in Pudukottai on Thursday.

As part of New Year celebrations, the Health Department has organised an exhibition creating awareness among the masses about health care.

Called Healthy Home (Arockia Illam), the exhibition, organised at Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Memorial Government Hospital here, provided vital tips to the visiting public about health care measures.

“It displays the advantages of ‘Nilavembu’, greens and vegetables.

With a view to attracting the visitors, the exhibits have been displayed with vital information about health care services such as 104 medical help line, 108 Ambulance and other essential services” said S. Syed Mohideen, Joint Director of Health and Rural Services. It contained information and tips about flu prevention, hand washing techniques, obesity prevention, ante-natal care, family welfare, anti-plastic methods by using cloth bags, chlorination of wells and other water sources, solar system, ill-effects of smoking and alcohol so on and so forth.

D. Parimaladevi, Dean cum Special Officer, Government Medical College, inaugurated the exhibition which is open till January 31.
title: Expo on healthy home
